‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà CMnd)
‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c4 ‚àà c5)
‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c1 : c4 ‚Üí c2))
‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1[finSupp]c3)
‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà TopSp)

comment: If a sum is finite, the usual sum is always a limit point of the topological sum (although it may not be the only limit point). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.) (Revised by AV, 24-Jul-2019.)
